reviews.text: Twas magical! I just love history and I cant help but imagine what it could must have been looked like when it was still whole. You better go see it for yourself
Really nice place, all the garden and ruins clean and quiet around. I really enjoy stay there. The restaurant is expensive so better bring your own snacks.

Beautiful and Majestic.  I hope everybody will visit this place, it will transport you to the past.  It's so romantic at night and you will love to hang around in their Gazebo Ristorante. Don't forget to try their Paella!
Nice place to visit the past. And much cozy if you visit during twilight the ruins closes at 8pm. Entrance is 100, students, senior citizens and pwds are discounted. Be sure to bring your ID.

I recommend that it is perfect timing when you go there during sunset because it gives a romantic ambiance while listening to their live band playing oldies but goodies hits. And it is some glimpse from the past to everybody who wants to go there. INSTAGRAMABLE!!!
Governor's office is located in this building.
立派な建物です。
Twas magical! I just love history and I cant help but imagine what it could must have been looked like when it was still whole. You better go see it for yourself
Really nice place, all the garden and ruins clean and quiet around. I really enjoy stay there. The restaurant is expensive so better bring your own snacks.

Beautiful and Majestic.  I hope everybody will visit this place, it will transport you to the past.  It's so romantic at night and you will love to hang around in their Gazebo Ristorante. Don't forget to try their Paella!
Nice place to visit the past. And much cozy if you visit during twilight the ruins closes at 8pm. Entrance is 100, students, senior citizens and pwds are discounted. Be sure to bring your ID.

I recommend that it is perfect timing when you go there during sunset because it gives a romantic ambiance while listening to their live band playing oldies but goodies hits. And it is some glimpse from the past to everybody who wants to go there. INSTAGRAMABLE!!!

It has been newly renovated. The New Government Center is indeed the center of Bacolod City. It is surrounded by call centers,  gasoline stations, a marketplace, cafes, stands, some small establishments as well. Just near are beer houses, restaurants, and bars. If you visit Bacolod, you should also visit this place. Most major city events are held here.

A recently built government centre of the city of Bacolod which houses the City Mayor's office and its constituents. Has several offices which is open during weekdays. The grounds and park is open 24/7 and often is a venue for city-sponsored events and such. The place is bordered with food shops and the like which is ideal for a day out or a night stroll. Often serves as a venue for family picnics as well.

It seems to be a good place whenever you want to unwind within the city, aside from saving money instead of expenses you can really enjoy a simply beautiful facade of the building and you could've relax with blind masseurs beside the fountain area in front of the building.

Your kids would definitely love the sparking toys displayed in the field in affordable price. Even your pets would be so loved enjoying the wide grassy field.

If you're new in the city and wants to get to know the culture of Bacoleños, this is the best place to go especially around 5pm onwards. You can see families hanging out, having picnic. I really appreciate the government in maintaining this place. Kudos.
The area is very friendly and relaxing. Good for jogging and walking. Open to everybody. The area is accessible. It is clean and safe.
Nice place :)
I think this is an underrated church. It has a simple exterior but the inside is very beautiful from the murals in the ceiling to the altar where a huge image of Jesus is displayed at the center.
one of the catholic church located in barangay alijis
I am verry happy that my specail someOne bring me hre at st.jude curch thank you MAHAL'Q
Beautiful architechture.
If you are catholic visit it.
They need to work on their sound system and clean up the wiring.

Location is good but since its along the national road, you can hear the noise outside. Food being served for breakfast is good.
Something new to be experience about since you'll be sleeping in an old house.
Very accommodating staff. :) Needs to improve the cleanliness of the toilet, especially the common one.

They renovate it into White Hotel.
Combination of antiquity and contemporary beauty. Love this place and will definitely come back.
Friendly staff and good location. The museum itself tells you a lot about the history of the family that used to live in that house.
It's cool to visit the past. The guide told me this will became a Filipino Style Hotel someday. :)
Long travel from the city but it's worth it: bought sacks of good quality vermicompost and organic compost mix.

If you wanna try the hand crafted draft beer, you need to sit inside. Beer mugs are not allowed outside... The waiter told me "it's dangerous". Outside you only can oder the enormous beer towers where the beer gets warm after a while.... Hahaha, not right, the beer is already warm, even inside were you get served mugs.
Haven't seen a big mug of beer like this. A must try. Nice ambience and acoustic music on Sundays.
Very chill abd relaxing place. We love the pizza and the homebrew. We also tried the home made potato chips (sour cream flavored) and it was really good. Will take photos next time.

Nice place for hanging out with friends with a nice variety of drinks and sides. With a touch of artistic wall paintings, the ambience is just perfect if you want to chill and enjoy the night with your friends.
Nice place. Delicious cake and home-made beer.
A good place to challenge yourself breathing, yet the food here is definitely worth it.
Namit Gid Experience. If you wanna have a local inasalan. Here you go.
Best inasalan ever 60php for 2 rice what a deal!!! I always eat at Mayor's the employees are very accommodating

Too smoky inside and has poor ventilation not for people with weak lungs, their CR are disgusting, washing areas are improvised water containers that some have mosquito larvae inside, but the good side are the food are  very cheap and tasty unless they burned your order.
very affordable inasalan in town. but the smoke is really a turn off.
Nothing beats Aida's at Manokan Country. The way the cook their chicken and the tenderness of this grilled chicken is the best! A good meal per person would be about P150 to P180.

A must place to eat at when you visit bacolod. Food is good for the price. The place is really warm on hot days but its still worth it. Good for large groups. I would go back there to bring friends who have not tried it yet.

First time to visit Manokan Country and it didn't disappoint. There are many food stalls there offering the famous Bacolod Chicken Inasal that you must try but we chose Nena's Beth. They have many choices and the service is really good. They are really busy but you don't have to wait very long for your food to be served. Yummy food and we will definitely go back there.
The food at nenas 1 and 2 are great but still the issue is with the area. The sanitary. :(
I had the best chicken isaw from Aida's, they even pack your take out order ready for plane.
Nothing beats Aida's at Manokan Country. The way the cook their chicken and the tenderness of this grilled chicken is the best! A good meal per person would be about P150 to P180.

A must place to eat at when you visit bacolod. Food is good for the price. The place is really warm on hot days but its still worth it. Good for large groups. I would go back there to bring friends who have not tried it yet.

First time to visit Manokan Country and it didn't disappoint. There are many food stalls there offering the famous Bacolod Chicken Inasal that you must try but we chose Nena's Beth. They have many choices and the service is really good. They are really busy but you don't have to wait very long for your food to be served. Yummy food and we will definitely go back there.
The food at nenas 1 and 2 are great but still the issue is with the area. The sanitary. :(
I had the best chicken isaw from Aida's, they even pack your take out order ready for plane.

Great food. Though I'm not too happy with the long wait, the food was worth it. My friends and I were the only ones at the restaurant so we basically had their service all to ourselves. Fairly good overall. The place is huge and would be perfect for family or company events.
Nice chinese foods. Been a customer since our elementaries.
The best of all time chinese restaurant in the city!
food is okay not recommendable. some of their table cloths were dirty.

This is a Chinese Restaurant, I came with my family relatives to have lunched..Apollo Restaurant was quite well known among one of the oldest Chinese Restaurant here at the center of Bacolod City, a capital city of Negros Occidental.. I usually go to this place for their excellent food and good customer service..
Very good pizza. Pasta is good as well. Retail shop has alot of ingredients if your going to make a Italian dish at home.
Coffee was affordable. Ambience is cozy. Great for after-dinner hangouts.
nice place food eatery jce cream cakes deli shop  j love it
Good food! Good service! Reasonable price!
Manager is the best.. Awesome place to unwind and have coffee or some pastries..
The food is great but very poor services. Took 10mins for your drinks to be delivered. Too many tables that are unclean. Waiters/waitress responsed very slow.
Still great food! Service is not great. Waitress hardly smiles, asked for water 4 times until it was finally served.

The food was great for the price. The worst was that the service was horrible. It wasnt that busy other than the birthday party occupying their function rooms, and the crew were everywhere. However, it was difficult to get their attention. And if we do get it, they would tell us to wait long enough that we had to call on another. Also, the food too too long to prepare. We ordered at around 6.30pm and the food arrived by 7.15pm. And we kept on asking for service water, maybe around 5 times, and we never were served up until we left.
such a great place! brought my girfriend here for dinner and she was suprised by the prices of the food, affordable AF! love their Maguro Don ❤💕🐟😍

Ive been going to this restaurant since i was a little kid. Everything is just as i remembered: great food, amazing staff and a wholesome environment. 

Plenty of parking.
Restrooms in the back. 
Bar seats. 
Two teppanyaki tables/grills. 
Private events space.

2006 was the last time before today that i had stepped into this restaurant. It has been at least 13 years that i have come visit, and one of the servers who had looked very familiar recognized me and my grandfather. The familiar server's name is Loreto, and he had been working in Kaisei for over 21 years since the writing of this review. He had said that my grandfather used to go to the restaurant with a young child. That young child was me. He remembered who we were, and that definitely means a lot to us. My childhood is attached to this restaurant and the many memories my family and I shared when i was still in Bacolod. 

Please pay this place a visit when you are coming by, or having tours, or even suggest this to a friend or a colleague.
Good food. Value for money. Nice location of place with parking and wheelchair access....

Saw this place passing by many times and from the outside it looked like a very nice place. I can't say much but the menu is very diverse offering that sets it apart from other places. They have good pad thai, just needs crushed PEANUTS.
Appropriate serving of food for the price and also food quality is great =)
Make sure to order the crispy sardines as an appetizer then try their sizzling bulalo and beef kebabs
The service is very good and the food is delicious.
Home of Negros's delicacies. They have a wide variety of local Negros kakanin. Worth the visit, worth the taste.

They have one of the best local delicasies in town, i have been enjoying Quan since i was in high school and that's about 20 years back and their food has been becoming better and now offers even more to date. Staffs are extra friendly and accomodating.
good food
Love the food (always) and the ambiance.
Superb, inexpensive food, cooked like home.
This restaurant remains one of my favorites in Bacolod. Known for their Mongolian and the famous Sate Babe. The taste has been the same for the last 25 years! It brings back my childhood nostalgia!
An old restaurant which is famous among locals. Try their Sate Babe.

Food quality is good. Sate Babe tastes the same after all these years. Pastries are a good addition. I was a little disappointed not to have my favorite pecan pie but the cashew pie was a good replacement. The ambiance is still good although a little bit more commercialized than I remember. Service is still good, waiters are attentive but since they have to serve more people may take time to get to you (compared to before). Still waiter response time is better than.most restaurants. Overall a good experience and its nice to eat at Bobs once again. Till next time. :-)
Good service, good food, good ambiance, clean place
Home cooked meals, affordable prices. Homey, casual atmosphere. Good, attentive wait staff. Wide variety of food choices . Near hospital and main street of Bacolod.
Best batchoy ever. You can order extra broth, if you ran out of it. Portions are enough for one person, but might overwhelm a few. :) Cozy place. Courteous staff. 😍
i love their food. reasonable prices and the staff are friendly. i love their honey-glazed chicken!

I think when you’re in Bacolod this place is a must (Batchoy and Filipino fusion dishes) . But sometimes they’re inconsistent with their dishes and even their rice now is not good. 21 , please use a good quality rice.
Nice place, good atmosphere, food was great 👌
Very good service and preparing food.
The food is great but very poor services. Took 10mins for your drinks to be delivered. Too many tables that are unclean. Waiters/waitress responsed very slow.
Still great food! Service is not great. Waitress hardly smiles, asked for water 4 times until it was finally served.

The food was great for the price. The worst was that the service was horrible. It wasnt that busy other than the birthday party occupying their function rooms, and the crew were everywhere. However, it was difficult to get their attention. And if we do get it, they would tell us to wait long enough that we had to call on another. Also, the food too too long to prepare. We ordered at around 6.30pm and the food arrived by 7.15pm. And we kept on asking for service water, maybe around 5 times, and we never were served up until we left.
such a great place! brought my girfriend here for dinner and she was suprised by the prices of the food, affordable AF! love their Maguro Don ❤💕🐟😍

Plenty of parking.

It has been at least 13 years that i have come visit, and one of the servers who had looked very familiar recognized me and my grandfather. The familiar server's name is Loreto, and he had been working in Kaisei for over 21 years since the writing of this review. He had said that my grandfather used to go to the restaurant with a young child. That young child was me. He remembered who we were, and that definitely means a lot to us. My childhood is attached to this restaurant and the many memories my family and I shared when i was still in Bacolod. 

Please pay this place a visit when you are coming by, or having tours, or even suggest this to a friend or a colleague.

It is one of the best specialty coffee shops in Vienna. We arrived in a Monday morning and it was very busy. Design is very catchy with beautiful colors gamma and a very functional use of space.The menu is simple focused on specialty coffee and complementary products. We tried both origins for espresso and they were both very good. We ordered a Ethiopia first. It was flavorful light roast, a bit herbal citric. Second espresso was a Brazil, a bit on the dark side but still much better than other Brazil we tried in Vienna. It seems there is a good slice of customers that prefer dark classic roasts even in the specialty coffee shops. We also tried their batch brew and it was very pleasant. They also serve other brew methods but is was a bit too much for us to try it all in a  single morning. The food - mostly deserts but they had sandwiches options as well, was very good. A nice selection of pastry and tarts complementary to coffee. Beside these products they serve teas, refreshments, wines and a nice little selection of spirits.The staff was very polite and they move very fast. It is always a very nice surprise for travelers to run into staff that speaks perfect English.

This is definitely a must visit coffee bar in Vienna. I am not really a coffee person in fact I don't drink coffee at all but man I was blown away by the coffee that Balthasar had. The place is small and cosy. I visited this place twice and both times it was packed. I am hardly surprised with that considering the delicious coffee that they offer... They also do have some quick bites on the menu to go with the coffee. I visited this place after reading their reviews and my God it was worth it. I would definitely return to this place if I am in Vienna ever again...

THE BEST coffee in Vienna! 
it might not be the typical Viennese café house( which also has its charm) BUT, it has excellent coffee, the best oat milk, pretty tasty and simple pastries, cute and very efficient staff and a great atmosphere.
so if you're looking for a fast good quality coffee or on the other hand , a place to sit down with your Laptop and drink a few coffees , than you are in the right place! 
just be aware that because it's not such a big place (not like Starbucks) you might be without a sit...
Nice quirky coffee shop.  Very tasty coffee, relaxed atmosphere and friendly staff.  Worth a visit.

Very nice bar. Wanted to visit this place after I saw it in a video on YouTube about Vienna. My hotel was just down the road. The coffee was nice and there was a good selection of sandwiches and pastry to choose from. The staff were also very pleasant even though I don't really speak German!
Best batchoy ever. You can order extra broth, if you ran out of it. Portions are enough for one person, but might overwhelm a few. :) Cozy place. Courteous staff. 😍
i love their food. reasonable prices and the staff are friendly. i love their honey-glazed chicken!

I think when you’re in Bacolod this place is a must (Batchoy and Filipino fusion dishes) . But sometimes they’re inconsistent with their dishes and even their rice now is not good. 21 , please use a good quality rice.
Nice place, good atmosphere, food was great 👌
Very good service and preparing food.
